definitions.definition: to destroy or badly damage something:
examples: The explosion shattered nearby windows and wrecked two cars.
He has been warned that his behaviour might wreck his chances of promotion.

definitions.definition: a vehicle or ship that has been destroyed or badly damaged:
examples: Divers exploring the wreck managed to salvage some coins and jewellery.

definitions.definition: someone who is in bad physical or mental condition:
examples: The stress she had been under at work reduced her to a nervous/quivering wreck.
